meanings.definition: To form a patina on (a surface)
meanings.sent1: Over time, the copper statue will patinate, creating a beautiful green color.
meanings.sent2: The old bronze doorknob began to patinate, giving it a weathered look.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled vinegar on the table, hoping it would patinate like antique furniture.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to patinate the canvas, transforming it into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The rust slowly started to patinate the metal gate, adding character to the garden entrance.

meanings.sent1: If left exposed to the elements, the metal will patinate naturally over time.
meanings.sent2: The bronze sculpture will patinate beautifully as it ages in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The curious child wondered if the old coins would patinate if left in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The antique mirror seemed to patinate magically, reflecting memories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The metal roof began to patinate, blending harmoniously with the surrounding nature.

meanings.definition: A thin layer that forms on the surface of metal or stone
meanings.sent1: The patinate on the ancient statue gave it a sense of history and elegance.
meanings.sent2: The patinate on the copper pot protected it from corrosion and wear.
meanings.sent3: The archaeologist carefully examined the patinate on the artifact to determine its age.
meanings.sent4: The patinate on the metal gate shimmered in the sunlight, creating a mesmerizing effect.
meanings.sent5: The patinate on the stone steps showed the passage of time through its subtle changes.
